data.name: Chess - Pawn move generator
data.description:
A Pawn on the chess board has the most complex rules defining its
movement. The following rules define how it moves:

In the followings ahead means upwards the board (higher ranks) for
white pawns, and downwards the board (lower ranks) for black pawns. Ranks are the "rows" on the chessboard. Files are "columns" on the chessboard.

 * a pawn always moves ahead and can never move backwards.
 * from the second (seventh) rank a white (black) pawn can move
   either two or one rank forward
 * it cannot capture pieces on the squares it normally moves to
   following the previous rules
 * when it moves two squares, the square in between its original
   position and the new position has to be empty
 * it can capture opponents pieces on the squares one rank ahead
   and one file to the right or to the left
 * if a pawn moves two ranks forward from the second rank (or
   seventh rank in case of a black pawn), bypassing an opponent pawn
   that could have captured it if it was moving only one rank, the
   opponent can still capture it on the next half move. This is
   called "en passant". If the pawn is not captured on the following
   half move, then the right to capture it is lost.
 * when a pawn reaches the first or eights rank (the base rank of
   the opponent, it promotes to either a Rook, Knight, Bishop or Queen.


The `Square` type comprises a file and a rank, and represents one of
the 64 squares of a chess board. The `Move` type has two squares,
one where the piece moves from and one that the piece moves to. It also optionally contains the promotion piece type.

Your function has to list all possible pawn moves. Feel free to extend to above classes with your convinience functions or define new classes.
